intro: Maianthemum bifolium var. dilatatum, commonly known as the broad-leaf false lily of the wall, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Convallariaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
